Parameters: @B_android#graphics#Path_E@
Path: The path for the stroke that continues this one. The starting point of this path must match the ending point of the stroke it continues.
long

long: The time, in milliseconds, from the time the gesture starts to the time this stroke should start. Must not be negative. This time is from the start of the new gesture, not the one being continued.
long
long: The duration for the new stroke. Must not be negative.
boolean
boolean: true if this stroke will be continued by one in the next gesture false otherwise.
continueStroke(android.graphics.Path,lon.Description: Create a new stroke that will continue this one. This is only possible if this stroke will continue.
continueStroke(android.graphics.Path,lon.FullName: public GestureDescription.StrokeDescription continueStroke (Path path, long startTime, long duration, boolean willContinue)

Returns: the start time for this stroke.

Parameters: @B_android#graphics#Path_E@

Path: The path to follow. Must have exactly one contour. The bounds of the path must not be negative. The path must not be empty. If the path has zero length (for example, a single moveTo()), the stroke is a touch that doesn't move. This value must never be null.
long
long: The time, in milliseconds, from the time the gesture starts to the time the stroke should start. Must not be negative. Value is 0 or greater
long
long: The duration, in milliseconds, the stroke takes to traverse the path. Must be positive. Value is 0 or greater
GestureDescription.StrokeDescription(and.FullName: public GestureDescription.StrokeDescription (Path path, long startTime, long duration)

Returns: true if the stroke is to be continued.
willContinue().Description: Check if this stroke is marked to continue in the next gesture.

Parameters: @B_android#graphics#Path_E@

Path: The path to follow. Must have exactly one contour. The bounds of the path must not be negative. The path must not be empty. If the path has zero length (for example, a single moveTo()), the stroke is a touch that doesn't move. This value must never be null.
long
long: The time, in milliseconds, from the time the gesture starts to the time the stroke should start. Must not be negative. Value is 0 or greater
long
long: The duration, in milliseconds, the stroke takes to traverse the path. Must be positive. Value is 0 or greater
boolean
boolean: true if this stroke will be continued by one in the next gesture false otherwise. Continued strokes keep their pointers down when the gesture completes.

getPath().Description: Retrieve a copy of the path for this stroke

ClassDesc: Immutable description of stroke that can be part of a gesture.
